docs.snippet: Trading in Argentine pesos was suspended yesterday in the wake of the revolution in that country. Brokers here said that since trading was suspended and some banks in Buenos Aires were closed, there was no way of knowing what the peso was worth.
docs.lead_paragraph: Trading in Argentine pesos was suspended yesterday in the wake of the revolution in that country. Brokers here said that since trading was suspended and some banks in Buenos Aires were closed, there was no way of knowing what the peso was worth.

headline.main: Argentina's Revolution Halts Deals in Its Currency Here

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, April 3-- The Government said today that a two-day navy revolt had been smashed following heavy attacks on rebel-held installations.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, April 3-- The Government said today that a two-day navy revolt had been smashed following heavy attacks on rebel-held installations.
docs.abstract: Govt repts revolt smashed after its forces bomb and heavily damage 2 navy bases; Rear Adm Vazquez, in BA for truce talks, said to demand ban on Peronism; fighting described; illus; 25 reptd dead, 34 hurt

headline.main: ARGENTINA SAYS REVOLT IS ENDED; TRUCE TALKS ON; Government Forces Bomb Navy's Bases--Fleet Head Seeks Peace ARGENTINA SAYS REVOLT IS ENDED

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, April 5-- The Government announced an accord today with rebel military leaders to end the four-day navy revolt.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, April 5-- The Government announced an accord today with rebel military leaders to end the four-day navy revolt.
docs.abstract: Govt announces truce with rebel navy leaders; most rebels surrender at Puerto Belgrano; some leaders flee to exile; truce terms

headline.main: Argentine Accord Ends Navy Revolt; ARGENTINE TERMS END NAVY REVOLT

docs.snippet: SOME time before Alekhine's style electrified chess play,  Capablanca, who was champion of the world and bored with no more worlds to conquer, made a dire prophecy.

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, April 6 --The members of the LatinAmerican free-trade zone have come out strongly in favor of setting up a lending institution to finance their exports.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, April 6 --The members of the LatinAmerican free-trade zone have come out strongly in favor of setting up a lending institution to finance their exports.
docs.abstract: Latin-Amer free trade zone members, at Bogota meeting, back Inter-Amer Development Bank proposal to set up lending inst to help finance exports and meet competition from advanced indus nations

headline.main: LATIN TRADE ZONE URGES A NEW BANK; U.S. Reported Cool to Plan for Financing Exports
